2 For purposes of this paper, "cream skimming" refers to concentration on serving only those markets that exhibit lower-than-average delivery costs, regardless of the characteristic that causes those costs to be less than average.
They are a product of the territory served and the current state of technology which would be employed by an efficient firm.
Postal Service and in that sense it is an upper bound.
Delivery function" as used in this paper refers to street delivery.
Because a large proportion of street costs are fixed,27 the unit (per piece) street cost initially declines rapidly as volume increases and continues to decline at a decreasing rate.

This paper measures the returns to scale of the U.S. delivery function.

3 This paper sets up a framework to examine the following question: Do the economies of scale in the delivery function exceed the technical inefficiencies and economic rents of the Postal Service?

This paper next estimates the value of scale in delivery exhibited by 21 national postal systems based on data from an unpublished paper which was presented at the 1994 Stockholm conference on Postal and Delivery Services.
This paper measures the returns to scale of the U.S. delivery function.
